column4: if I made a fat32 partition that I wanted linux and windows to both have access to, how can I make it so that the partition is mounted and accessible whenever I boot to linux?  If it already is mounted and accessible, how do I access it?
add the partition to /etc/fstab in order to have it mount when you boot. To access it just browse to it in nautilus
if you have used nano, to save and close you do CTRL + X and then answer yes when it asks you if you want to save it
